task.description: Implement support for custom HTML headers and footers in generated PDFs. Chrome CDP supports HTML templates for headers/footers with special variables for page numbers, dates, etc.

acceptance-criteria.criterion: Templates support CDP variables (pageNumber, totalPages, date, etc.)
displayHeaderFooter option must be true to show headers/footers
Templates support HTML and CSS styling
Helper methods for common header/footer patterns
Integration tests validate headers/footers in PDF

implementation-notes.note: CDP supported template variables: - - current page number - - total page count - - formatted date - - document title - - document URL
Template must be valid HTML with inline CSS
Default font size is 10px for headers/footers
Add convenience methods in PdfOptions.Builder: - .simplePageNumbers() - "Page X of Y" - .headerWithTitle() - .footerWithDate()
displayHeaderFooter must be set to true in printToPDF

testing-requirements.requirement: Integration test with custom header and footer
Verify headers/footers appear in generated PDF

implementation-summary.summary: Successfully implemented custom header and footer support for PDF generation. Added four convenience methods to PdfOptions.Builder for common header/footer patterns.

changes.change: Added PdfOptions.Builder.simplePageNumbers() - Adds footer with "Page X of Y" format
Added PdfOptions.Builder.headerWithTitle() - Adds header with document title
Added PdfOptions.Builder.footerWithDate() - Adds footer with current date
Added PdfOptions.Builder.standardHeaderFooter() - Combines title header and page number footer
All convenience methods automatically enable displayHeaderFooter flag
Added 7 unit tests in PdfOptionsBuilderTest covering all convenience methods
Created HeaderFooterIT with 9 integration tests validating actual PDF generation
All templates use valid HTML with inline CSS and CDP-supported span classes

implementation-summary.tests-passing: All 332 unit tests passing (added 7 new tests)
